cyclone.name: NESTOR
cyclone.current_location: about 85 miles (140 km) southwest of Apalachicola, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: Moving northeast toward the Florida Panhandle, then accelerating east-northeast across Georgia and the Carolinas before emerging into the western Atlantic and passing offshore of the Mid-Atlantic coast

weather_observation.watch_coast: Tropical-storm warning in force from Navarre FL to Yankeetown FL (Gulf Coast)
weather_observation.warning_coast: Storm-surge warning from Indian Pass FL to Clearwater Beach FL
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Florida Gulf Coast, then coastal GA/SC/NC and southeastern Virginia as the system moves NE and offshore
weather_observation.wind: Low chance (≤6%) of tropical-storm-force winds; breezy conditions and occasional gale gusts possible Sunday
weather_observation.rainfall: Periods of heavy rain Sunday into early Monday, 2–3 inches with isolated 4 inches
weather_observation.other_hazards: Rough seas and elevated waves in Chesapeake Bay and approaches; minor coastal flooding possible at high tide
